Conversation.line: Setting course to... I don't remember. I'll look at the waypoints
How do you not remember our destination?
I don't even remember myself.
Maybe captain is tired!
Siddown and enjoy the ride. We're off.
Hopefully its not that long.
Yes, captain.
Captain speaking. We are off to destination!
Yes, sir.
Remember Our Cause.
Any chance we have a heater on-board?
Probably not. Just sit by the reactor. Definitely a good idea.
Dream on.
Ever wonder why some subs use fusion reactors?
Either budget cuts or just out of necessity, I'd guess.
I heard they're less dangerous, too.
Anything's dangerous, technically. It's just if you're a moron or not.
Me too. I prefer to not put it to the test, though.
I won't treat papercuts any longer. Don't come to me for one. It ain't gonna happen.
You know, one time I found an antique revolver on some Husk's corpse.
Quite old. Probably inherited from generations.
I need to restore it.
Plan on using it?
Probably not. I'll keep it on display for when I get my own office.
I don't want it to wear down any more.
Maybe when I move on from my captain position, you'll take my role.
Y'all got a significant other?
Yup. Met them at an outpost I grew up on. We talk on occasion.
What happens during those extended periods of no communication?
Well, we came to the understanding it'll happen. They've been loyal.
That's what I'd fear if I was with someone.
...Good question.
Forever alone. Hard to have one when you're always moving about.
Husks don't need a rela- ah. Maybe I'll shut up.
Three words: one night stand.
Hear me out: a Black Order Husk army.
Find converted husks, or just infect prisoners.
Send them out to do our dirty work. Less actual casualties, easier time.
...That's actually a half decent idea, and I hate it.
Okay, but who gets the paycheck then?
Sure, but how would we control them? Not like they follow our ideology.
Even by my standards, let's just not.
Y'all remember Tesla? The automotive company?
The more I think about it, our autopilot system's sort of like theirs.
In the sense that it can't turn corners, hits every pedestrian, or screams at you when your hands are off the wheel?
Ours does more than theirs: underwater navigation. Whoop dee doo.
Yeah. I wonder if they're still around.
If they are, it's definitely not one of their priorities to reach us here, that's for sure.
Have y'all heard about Commissar A-5?
Apparently they're part of the reason why the lot of us Order personnel are stuck on this rock.
I saw it in some Europan Coalition article. I don't remember the specifics but it's said that our return - both Order and Europans alike - is very much possible. They just aren't doing it.
I smell bullshit. If they had the means, they'd pull us out. Might want to cut the newspaper from your knowledge diet.
I overheard that some Order scientists are testing out a new type of fission fuel.
Apparently it's supposed to be for low-power submarines that want to stay out in the water for longer periods on a single rod.
What is it made of?
Not sure. Said it was some type of compound. Not Fulgurium, though. That's what confuses me.
Whatever it is, I'm bringing you to my next shopping run to find it.
The more I think of it, the more I realize that perhaps the Church of Husk isn't that bad of an idea.
Stop talking.
And if I don't? The Order promotes free speech.
And we don't tolerate idiocracy.
It isn't idiocracy. It's fact. Look at the-
Do I need to eject both of you? Shut the fuck up.
Can we have some silence for once?
I wish you all would realize how grand the Husks are.
Shut the fuck up.
I wish you all would realize this fucker should be cycled in an airlock.
I would if the Coalition would let me.
They adapt to the seas better than we ever could, and are the future of human society.
I'll believe you when we encounter a husk that doesn't try to brutally violate us.
